intro: Rhodosepala pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered rhodosepala, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has simple, ovate leaves with a smooth upper surface and a hairy underside. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
